abstract: If there is an upside to the recent downturn in the deal-making business, it was expressed Wednesday by Jonathan Nelson, the chief executive of Providence Equity Partners, a media-focused private equity firm. “It’s the first time in four years that professionals at Providence have had a chance to take a vacation,” he told the audience at the Dow Jones Private Equity Analyst conference in New York.
lead_paragraph: If there is an upside to the recent downturn in the deal-making business, it was expressed Wednesday by Jonathan Nelson, the chief executive of Providence Equity Partners, a media-focused private equity firm. “It’s the first time in four years that professionals at Providence have had a chance to take a vacation,” he told the audience at the Dow Jones Private Equity Analyst conference in New York.

headline.main: Golf Anyone? Bankers Bide Their Time
